children.text: The tie down from the roof, down through the walls/floor is not continuous down to the slab.
Clause 9.6 Specific Tie-Down Fixing of AS 1684 Residential Timber-Framed Construction, states that
‘Continuity of tie-down shall be provided from the roof sheeting to the foundations’ .
All of these framing members will need to be properly strapped and tied to each other so that the sheet roof can resist the expected uplift from wind loads.
